metadata.title: CVE-2021-45463 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
load_cache in GEGL before 0.4.34 allows shell expansion when a pathname ina constructed command line is not escaped or filtered. This is caused byuse of the system library function for execution of the ImageMagick convertfallback in magick-load. NOTE: GEGL releases before 0.4.34 are used in GIMPreleases before 2.10.30; however, this does not imply that GIMP buildsenable the vulnerable feature.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45463` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gegl - 0.4.22-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
gir1.2-gegl-0.4 - 0.4.22-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
libgegl-0.4-0 - 0.4.22-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
libgegl-common - 0.4.22-3ubuntu0.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: gegl package in esm-apps/focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.22-3ubuntu0.1~esm1').
